alert.note: Alert for Kenosha; Racine; Walworth (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 18 at 8:28PM CST until February 18 at 9:30PM CST by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Milwaukee/Sullivan has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Walworth County in southeastern Wisconsin... Racine County in southeastern Wisconsin... Northwestern Kenosha County in southeastern Wisconsin... * Until 930 PM CST. * At 827 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Brookfield to 7 miles north of Darien, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstates 94 and 43. Locations impacted include... Elkhorn, Delavan, Lake Geneva, Union Grove, East Troy, Williams Bay, Wind Lake, Rochester, Raymond, Wheatland, Yorkville, Genoa City, Walworth, Fontana-On-Geneva Lake, Sharon, Powers Lake, Browns Lake, Como, Waterford North and Pell Lake. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
